Class SolrMgr

    SolrMgrIf

    public class SolrMgr
extends BaseMgr
implements SolrMgrIf
    Manager for code to interface with Solr

      • beforeSendQuery

        protected java.lang.String beforeSendQuery(java.lang.String sessionId,
                               java.lang.String queryString,
                               DataDescriptorIf dataDesc,
                               ProductSearchIf prodSearch,
                               int languageId,
                               FetchProductOptionsIf options)
                                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Method that can be used to customize the query string. The query string does not include the SOLR URL.
        Parameters:
        sessionId - The sessionId of the logged in user
        queryString - Query string that will be sent to SOLR
        dataDesc - DataDescriptor object
        prodSearch - ProductSearch object which may be null
        languageId - Language id
        options - a FetchProductOptions object which may be null
        Returns:
        Returns the customized query string
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • sendQueryToSolr

        public java.lang.String sendQueryToSolr(java.lang.String query,
                               int type,
                               java.lang.String action)
                                 throws org.apache.torque.TorqueException,
                                        com.workingdogs.village.DataSetException,
                                        java.lang.Exception
        Sends the query to Solr. It actually tries a maximum of two times to send the query to Solr. If there's a connection exception on the first call it calls refreshConfigs before trying a second time. If it fails the second time this will return an Exception indicating what the problem was.
        Specified by:
        sendQueryToSolr in interface SolrMgrIf
        Parameters:
        query - The parameters for the HTTP GET
        type - The type of query
        action - The action for the query. Type is ignored if action is not null.
        Returns:
        Returns the SOLR response
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        com.workingdogs.village.DataSetException
        org.apache.torque.TorqueException

      • sendQueryToSolr

        public java.lang.String sendQueryToSolr(java.lang.String query,
                               int type,
                               java.lang.String action,
                               int attempt)
                                 throws org.apache.torque.TorqueException,
                                        com.workingdogs.village.DataSetException,
                                        java.lang.Exception
        Sends the query to Solr
        Specified by:
        sendQueryToSolr in interface SolrMgrIf
        Parameters:
        query - The parameters for the HTTP GET
        type - The type of query
        action - The action for the query. Type is ignored if action is not null.
        attempt - indicates the attempt number when Solr calls are retried
        Returns:
        Returns the SOLR response
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getCustomSearchString

        protected java.lang.String getCustomSearchString(java.math.BigDecimal searchDec,
                                     int rule,
                                     int customFieldNum)
        Creates a search string based on the rule.
        Parameters:
        searchDec - The search Big Decimal
        rule - The rule for determining whether to introduce less than, greater than etc.
        customFieldNum - Used to detect which custom field is being used
        Returns:
        Returns a search string for solr

      • escapeSearchString

        public java.lang.String escapeSearchString(java.lang.String searchString)
        The Lucene search engine requires the following characters to be escaped: + - ! ( ) { } [ ] ^ " ~ * ? : \
        Specified by:
        escapeSearchString in interface SolrMgrIf
        Parameters:
        searchString -
        Returns:
        Returns the escaped string

      • getSolrUrl

        public java.lang.String getSolrUrl()
                            throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: SolrMgrIf
        Get the Solr URL. It will return a URL in for form: http://node:8983/ Note that it does not include the "/solr/konakart" that is often appended by another method.
        Specified by:
        getSolrUrl in interface SolrMgrIf
        Returns:
        Returns a URL which will be used to access Solr.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
